tn.text: This was the temple of God.
men's names (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

This is the name of the province that was west of the Euphrates River. It was across the river from the city of Susa. See how you translated it in [[:en:bible:notes:ezr:04:09|4:10]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
The eye is a metonym for the person watching over another person. AT: "God was watching over" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: for a letter to be sent to the king and for a decree to be returned to them
tn.text: This can be translated in active form. AT: "for an official to send a letter to the king and for the king to send a letter back to them with a decree" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: This is a copy of the letter
tn.text: Ezra includes the contents of the letter to King Darius regarding their work on the temple.

This is the name of the province that was west of the Euphrates River. It was across the river from the city of Susa. Translate as in [[:en:bible:notes:ezr:04:09|4:10]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

wood for building
"Who gave you permission"
The letter from Tattenai to the king that began in [[:en:bible:notes:ezr:05:06|5:7]] continues.

tn.ref: We are servants of the one
tn.text: Possible meaning are 1) they were calling the Jewish people servants of God or 2) those who replied were from the tribe of Levi and Aaron, who were the ones actually responsible for the temple worship and sacrifices.

tn.ref: that had been built many years ago when the great king of Israel built it and completed it
tn.text: This can be translated in active form. AT: "that the great king of Israel had built and supplied all the equipment for" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"supplied all the equipment for it"
The letter from Tattenai to the king continues. Tattenai continues to tell the king what the Judeans had told him beginning in [[:en:bible:notes:ezr:05:11|5:11]].
"made the God of heaven become very angry with us"

tn.ref: he gave them into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, who destroyed this house and took the people
tn.text: The hand is a metonym for power or control. Also, "Nebuchadnezzar" represents his army. AT: "allowed Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon, and his army to destroy this house and to take the people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"tore down this house"

tn.ref: Cyrus issued a decree to rebuild the house of God
tn.text: Cyrus ordered that the people rebuild God's temple.

The letter from Tattenai to the king that began in [[:en:bible:notes:ezr:05:06|5:7]] continues. Tattenai continues to tell the king what the Judeans had told him beginning in ([[:en:bible:notes:ezr:05:11|5:11]]).
Translate as in [[:en:bible:notes:ezr:01:07]].
King Cyrus returned the temple objects.

tn.ref: Let the house of God be rebuilt
tn.text: This can be translated in active form. AT: "I want the Judeans to rebuild the house of God" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

The letter from Tattenai to the king that began in [[:en:bible:notes:ezr:05:06|5:7]] continues. Tattenai continues to tell the king what the Judeans had told him beginning in ([[:en:bible:notes:ezr:05:11|5:11]]).

tn.ref: it is being constructed, but is not yet complete
tn.text: This can be translated in active form. AT: "people are now constructing it, but they have not done all the work yet" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
built

The letter from Tattenai to the king that began in [[:en:bible:notes:ezr:05:06|5:7]] continues. Tattenai has finished telling the king what the Judeans told him and now asks the king to see if what the Judeans told him was true.
This can be translated in active form. AT: "I would like you to have someone investigate this matter" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: if a judgment from King Cyrus exists there
tn.text: "if there is a record there that King Cyrus issued a law"
